s.text: I believe the current level of taxation is illegitimate because it is done without the consent of the governed.
During the Vietnam War, some conscientious objectors believed they were acting for the good of the country and did so at great personal risk.
While no one really likes forking over taxes, that money pays for a multitude of government services and functions.
(No need to go into the national scandal of schools going academically easy on their athletes and graduating dumb people.)
I am asking you: Why is everything so hard now--more so than 25 years ago?
